      wherein A is NH2 or OH; and B is H or NH2; or pharmaceutically acceptable salt or hydrate thereof.
    50. 50. The method of clause 49, wherein said viral infection comprises infection with one or more viruses.
    51. 51. The method of cause 49 or 50, wherein A is NH2 and B is H.
    52. 52. The method of clause 49 or 50, wherein A is OH and B is NH2.
    53. 53. The method of any of clauses 49-52, wherein the viral infection comprises a virus selected from the group consisting of orthmyxoviridac, paramyxoviridae, arenaviridae, bunyaviridae, flaviviridac, filoviridae, togaviridae, picornaviridae, and coronaviridae families.
    54. 54. The method of any of clauses 49-53, wherein the viral infection is selected from the group consisting of adenovirus, rhinovirus, hepatitis, immunodeficiency virus, polio, measles, Ebola, Coxsackie, Rhino, West Nile, small pox, encephalitis, yellow fever, Dengue fever, influenza A, influenza B, lassa, lymphocytic choriomeningitis, junin, machuppo, guanarito, hantavirus, Rift Valley Fever, La Crosse, California encephalitis, Crimean-Congo, Marburg, Japanese Encephalitis, Kyasanur Forest, Venezuelan equine encephalitis, Eastern equine encephalitis, Western equine encephalitis, severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS), parainfluenza, respiratory syncytial, Punta Toro, Tacaribe and pachindae.
    55. 55. The method of any of clauses 49-54, wherein the viral infection is selected from the group consisting of adenovirus, Dengue Fever, influenza A, influenza B, Junin, measles, parainfluenza, Pichinde, punta toro, respiratory syncytial, rhinovirus, Rift Valley Fever, SARS-CoV, tacaribe, Venezuelan equine encephalitis, West Nile, and yellow fever viruses.
    56. 56. The method of any of clauses 49-55, wherein the viral infection is selected from the group consisting of Ebola, yellow fever, Marburg, influenza A and influenza B viruses.
    57. 57. The method of any of clauses 49-56, wherein the virus is Ebola.
    58. 58. The method of any of clauses 49-56, wherein the virus is measles.
    59. 59. The method of any of clauses 49-56, wherein the virus is yellow fever.
    60. 60. The method of any of clauses 49-56, wherein the virus is Marburg.
    61. 61. The method of any of clauses 49-56, wherein the viral infection is influenza A or influenza B.
    62. 62. The method of any of clauses 49-55, wherein the virus is West Nile.
    63. 63. The method of any of clauses 49-55, wherein the virus is Dengue fever.
    64. 64. The method of any of clauses 49-63, further comprising administration of an additional anti-viral agent.
    65. 65. The method of clause 64, wherein the additional anti-viral agent is selected from the group consisting of laninamivir, oseltamivir, zanamivir, and peramivir.
    66. 66. The method of clause 64 or 65, wherein the additional anti-viral agent is peramivir.
    67. 67. The method of any of clauses 49-66, wherein administration is selected from the group consisting of intravenous, interperitoneal, intramuscular, and oral.
    68. 68. The method of any of clauses 49-67, wherein administration is intravenous.
    69. 69. The method of any of clauses 49-67, wherein administration is intramuscular.
    70. 70. The method of any of clauses 49-67, wherein administration is oral.
    71. 71. A method for preventing viral infection in a subject comprising administering to the subject a therapeutically effective amount of a compound of formula I:
      wherein A is NH2 or OH; and B is H or NH2; or pharmaceutically acceptable salt or hydrate thereof.
    72. 72. The method of clause 71, wherein said viral infection comprises infection with one or more viruses.
    73. 73. The method of clause 71 or 72, wherein A is NH2 and B is H.
    74. 74. The method of clause 71 or 72, wherein A is OH and B is NH2.
    75. 75. The method of any of clauses 71-74, wherein the viral infection comprises a virus selected from the group consisting of orthmyxoviridae, paramyxoviridae, arenaviridae, bunyaviridae, flaviviridae, filoviridae, togaviridae, picornaviridae, and coronaviridae families.
    76. 76. The method of any of clauses 71-75, wherein said viral infection comprises infection with one or more virus selected from the group consisting of adenovirus, rhinovirus, hepatitis, immunodeficiency virus, polio, measles, Ebola, Coxsackie, Rhino, West Nile, small pox, encephalitis, yellow fever, Dengue fever, influenza A, influenza B, lassa, lymphocytic choriomeningitis, junin, machuppo, guanarito, hantavirus, Rift Valley Fever, La Crosse, California encephalitis, Crimean-Congo, Marburg, Japanese Encephalitis, Kyasanur Forest, Venezuelan equine encephalitis, Eastern equine encephalitis, Western equine encephalitis, severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS), parainfluenza, respiratory syncytial, Punta Toro, Tacaribe and pachindae viruses.
    77. 77. The method of any of clauses 71-76, wherein the viral infection is selected from the group consisting of adenovirus, Dengue Fever, influenza A, influenza B, Junin, measles, parainfluenza, Pichinde, punta toro, respiratory syncytial, rhinovirus, Rift Valley Fever, SARS-CoV, tacaribc, Venezuelan equine encephalitis, West Nile, and yellow fever viruses.
    78. 78. The method of any of clauses 71-77, wherein the viral infection is selected from the group consisting of Ebola, yellow fever, Marburg, influenza A and influenza B viruses.
    79. 79. The method of any of clauses 71-78, wherein the virus is Ebola.
    80. 80. The method of any of clauses 71-78, wherein the virus is measles.
    81. 81. The method of any of clauses 71-78, wherein the virus is yellow fever.
    82. 82. The method of any of clauses 71-78, wherein the virus is Marburg.
    83. 83. The method of any of clauses 71-78, wherein the viral infection is influenza A or influenza B.
    84. 84. The method of any of clauses 71-77, wherein the virus is West Nile.
    85. 85. The method of any of clauses 71-77, wherein the virus is Dengue fever.
    86. 86. The method of any of clauses 71-85, further comprising administration of an additional anti-viral agent.
    87. 87. The method of clause 86, wherein the additional anti-viral agent is selected from the group consisting of laninamivir, oseltamivir, zanamivir, and pcramivir.
    88. 88. The method of clause 86 or 87, wherein the additional anti-viral agent is peramivir.
    89. 89. The method of any of clauses 71-88, wherein administration is selected from the group consisting of intravenous, interperitoneal, intramuscular, and oral.
    90. 90. The method of any of clauses 71-89, wherein administration is intravenous.
    91. 91. The method of any of clauses 71-90, wherein administration is intramuscular.
    92. 92. The method of any of clauses 71-91, wherein administration is oral.

Claims (20)

  1. A compound of formula I:
    wherein A is NH2; and B is H; or a pharmaceutically acceptable salt or hydrate thereof, for use in treating, suppressing, or preventing a viral infection in a subject;
    wherein the viral infection comprises:
    (a) a virus selected from the group consisting of viruses of the orthomyxoviridae, paramyxoviridae, arenaviridae, bunyaviridae, flaviviridae, filoviridae, togaviridae, picornaviridae, and coronaviridae virus families; or
    (b) a virus selected from the group consisting of adenovirus, rhinovirus, hepatitis, immunodeficiency virus, polio, measles, Ebola, Coxsackie, West Nile, small pox, yellow fever, Dengue fever, influenza A, influenza B, lassa, lymphocytic choriomeningitis, Junin, Machupo, guanarito, hantavirus, Rift Valley Fever, La Crosse, California encephalitis, Crimean-Congo, Marburg, Japanese encephalitis, Kyasanur Forest, Venezuelan equine encephalitis, Eastern equine encephalitis, Western equine encephalitis, severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS), parainfluenza, respiratory syncytial, Punta Toro, Tacaribe, and Pichinde viruses.
  2. The compound for use according to claim 1, wherein the viral infection comprises a virus selected from the group consisting of viruses of the orthomyxoviridae, paramyxoviridae, arenaviridae, bunyaviridae, flaviviridae, filoviridae, togaviridae, picornaviridae, and coronaviridae families.
  3. The compound for use according to claim 1, wherein the viral infection is selected from the group consisting of adenovirus, Dengue fever, influenza A, influenza B, Junin, measles, parainfluenza, Pichinde, Punta Toro, respiratory syncytial, rhinovirus, Rift Valley Fever, SARS, Tacaribe, Venezuelan equine encephalitis, West Nile, and yellow fever viruses.
  4. The compound for use according to claim 3, wherein the viral infection is West Nile virus.
  5. The compound for use according to claim 3, wherein the viral infection is Dengue fever virus.
  6. The compound for use according to claim 3, wherein the viral infection is Rift Valley Fever virus.
  7. The compound for use according to claim 1, wherein viral infection is selected from the group consisting of Ebola, yellow fever, Marburg, influenza A and influenza B viruses.
  8. The compound for use according to claim 7, wherein the viral infection is Ebola virus.
  9. The compound for use according to claim 7, wherein the viral infection is Marburg virus.
  10. The compound for use according to claim 7, wherein the viral infection is yellow fever virus.
  11. The compound for use according to claim 7, wherein the viral infection is influenza A or influenza B virus.
  12. A compound of formula I:
    wherein A is NH2; and B is H; or a pharmaceutically acceptable salt or hydrate thereof, for use in the inhibition of RNA viral polymerase in a subject, wherein the RNA viral polymerase is:
    (a) a polymerase selected from the group consisting of orthomyxoviridae, paramyxoviridae, arenaviridae, bunyaviridae, flaviviridae, filoviridae, togaviridae, picornaviridae, and coronaviridae viral polymerases; or
    (b) a polymerase selected from the group consisting of rhinovirus, polio, measles, Ebola, Coxsackie, West Nile, small pox, yellow fever, Dengue fever, influenza A, influenza B, lassa, lymphocytic choriomeningitis, Junin, Machupo, guanarito, hantavirus, Rift Valley Fever, La Crosse, California encephalitis, Crimean-Congo, Marburg, Japanese encephalitis, Kyasanur Forest, Venezuelan equine encephalitis, Eastern equine encephalitis, Western equine encephalitis, severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS), parainfluenza, respiratory syncytial, Punta Toro, Tacaribe, and Pichinde viral polymerases.
  13. The compound for use according to claim 12, wherein the RNA viral polymerase is a polymerase selected from the group consisting of Dengue fever, influenza A, influenza B, Junin, measles, parainfluenza, Pichinde, Punta Toro, respiratory syncytial, rhinovirus, Rift Valley Fever, SARS, Tacaribe, Venezuelan equine encephalitis, West Nile, and yellow fever viral polymerases.
  14. The compound for use according to claim 13, wherein the RNA viral polymerase is West Nile, Dengue fever, or Rift Valley Fever viral polymerase.
  15. The compound for use according to claim 12, wherein the RNA viral polymerase is Ebola, yellow fever, Marburg, influenza A, or influenza B viral polymerase.
  16. The compound for use according to any one of claims 1-15, wherein the subject is a mammal.
  17. The compound for use according to any one of claims 1-15, wherein the subject is a human.
  18. The compound for use according to any preceding claim, further comprising administration of an additional anti-viral agent, optionally wherein the additional anti-viral agent is laninamivir, oseltamivir, zanamivir, or peramivir.
  19. The compound for use according to claim 18, wherein the additional anti-viral agent is peramivir.
  20. The compound for use according to any preceding claim, wherein the compound is formulated for intravenous, intraperitoneal, intramuscular, or oral administration.
